main event: A civilian reported a UFO sighting of a bright orange light on October 5, 1957, which disappeared as it continued moving. The observation lasted for a brief period and involved a single object.
interesting points: The UFO was observed on ground-radar, indicating that it was tracked by radar systems.
The report suggests that the UFO was initially considered to be a balloon, but the conclusion was uncertain due to insufficient data.
The bright orange light was seen to disappear while continuing its movement, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
The sighting was also reported to the Civil Defense, indicating official acknowledgment and investigation of the UFO event.
The UFO was observed in the SSW area, and although the light had disappeared, its glow remained, suggestive of unusual behavior.
witnesses: Civilian, SDO Capt Douglas J Davis
